item.title: Elden Ring Player Discovers OP Shield Feature After 1400 Hours In The Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Upgrading shields in Elden Ring can improve guard boost, affecting how much stamina is used per block, a crucial mechanic many missed.
  • With the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC approaching, players are revisiting the game, some fine-tuning builds while others start anew.
  • Some players, after 1400 hours of gameplay, discovered the importance of shield upgrades, a mechanic easily overlooked in Elden Ring.

An Elden Ring player came across the OP guard boost feature while upgrading their shield, which gives users much more incentive to use their Smithing Stones on something which might they might not consider their first priority. What's surprising is the fact that they discovered it after 1400 hours in Elden Ring , and many other players missed this mechanic too.

With the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC just a month away, several Elden Ring players are flocking back to the game to prepare for its release. While some are fine-tuning their Elden Ring builds to gear up for the challenge the Land of Shadows will bring, others are just starting from scratch all over again. Amid that, a player has come across a pivotal aspect about shields which is quite easy to miss.

Related
Kai Cenat Wins $100,000 After Beating Elden Ring Boss

Twitch Streamer Kai Cenat makes a bet that he can beat an Elden Ring boss on the first try, and after succeeding, wins a whopping $100,000.

In a post on the Elden Ring subreddit, user PompousGoblin reveals an interesting discovery they had after spending over a whopping 1400 hours in the game. They highlight that upgrading shields in Elden Ring was something that wasn't on their priority list considering it didn't affect the guard boost, which is by far one of the most crucial attributes of shields. However, since they had an abundance of Smithing Stones, they ended up upgrading it, only to realize that it does indeed affect the guard boost.

Two Years After Its Release, Several Elden Ring Fans Still Unaware of Shield Guard Boost

Guard boost, also known as stability, is a metric that determines how much stamina is used by the players per block. A shield with better guard boost attributes will ensure that players are able to get more blocks without running out of stamina. This affects the meta significantly, considering the fact that players will need to indirectly spend fewer points on increasing their stamina as well. It is quite easy to miss this, since shields only gain a guard boost after every few upgrades, so investing the precious Elden Ring Smithing Stones on shields early on in the game might not seem quite pivotal at first glance.

Surprisingly, many other players seemed to be unaware of this as well. In fact, a few didn't even know what the guard boost mechanic was. That being said, some in the community are not really sold on the idea of upgrading shields merely for guard boost and believe that it is only viable for a few shields in the game, such as Elden Ring 's popular Brass Shield . As with a number of other things in Elden Ring , a lot of factors influence this choice, with the overall build and playstyle being the most pivotal aspect.

item.title: Destiny 2 Players Aren’t Happy About Nerfs to Popular Sword
item.description:
Highlights

  • Destiny 2 players upset over nerfs to popular sword The Lament in upcoming expansion The Final Shape.
  • Bungie aiming for balance in game with changes to sword's healing effect, reducing its value as an Exotic weapon.
  • Community reactions split between anger and patience, waiting to see how changes actually affect gameplay before passing judgment.

The Destiny 2 community is complaining about a new set of changes developer Bungie has outlined impacting The Lament, one of the game's most popular swords. The complaints center around nerfs made to the sword's unique qualities, which players appreciated since its debut in the Destiny 2 Beyond Light expansion.

Balancing a live service game is a tricky proposition at the best of times. Developers need to toe the thin line between allowing players to enjoy the feeling of gaining an "unfair" advantage by using the most effective techniques and items while keeping a wide variety of options viable. Destiny 2 itself is no stranger to unpopular changes made in the name of balance , with players complaining regularly when the dev team attempts to tune popular classes, weapons, or abilities.

Related
Destiny 2 Final Shape DLC: The Pale Heart's Connection to the Traveler Explained

While the true function of the Traveler's Pale Heart is a mystery, its connection to the Traveler involves its ever-shifting, bizarre landscape.

The latest set of changes to set Destiny 2 players off involves the Weapon Tuning Preview for The Final Shape , the new expansion launching on June 4, 2024. The preview gave the community a look at what balance changes Bungie plans to implement with the debut of The Final Shape . Some of the fiercest reaction from the community centered around changes planned for the Exotic sword called The Lament.

Destiny 2 Will Nerf The Lament Exotic Sword in The Final Shape

According to Bungie's Weapon Tuning Preview post, the main changes affect The Lament's intrinsic "Banshee's Wail" Perk, which allows players to "rev" the chainsaw-like blade to increase its damage, and "Revved Consumption," which heals the wielder when damaging enemies. When The Final Shape launches, The Lament's healing effect will be about 20% less effective. Meanwhile, the damage done by The Lament with combos will affected by stacks of Banshee's Wail will also be about 20% lower. Bungie said that while the performance of The Lament was in line with other Destiny 2 swords , it felt the healing effect in particular was too strong, and removed a risk of using a sword in boss encounters: Exposing oneself to a powerful close-range "stomp" attack.

Players on the Destiny 2 subreddit reacted with anger, complaining that Bungie's nerfs unnecessarily affected the weapon's unique qualities, reducing its value as an Exotic weapon. They reasoned that reducing the healing effect's potency would make unlocking The Lament Exotic sword in Destiny 2 pointless. Since The Lament's overall damage output was comparable to Legendary swords, they argued, the healing effect was the only thing that made The Lament stand out as a candidate for a player's coveted Exotic weapon slot. Without it, The Lament was better off shunned in favor of bringing a different Exotic weapon instead.

Some calmer commenters pointed out that the nerfs aren't due out until The Final Shape actually launches, suggesting that the reaction is somewhat premature, since no one has had a chance to see the changes affect existing strategies. As such, it'd be up to real-world testing and seeing how the changes affect The Lament's performance under live conditions that could spur Bungie to roll the change back later.

item.title: Epic Games Boss Teases Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3 Theme
item.description:
Highlights

  • Epic Games' Mark Rein dropped the word "Nitro," hinting at a potential post-apocalyptic theme for the next Fortnite season.
  • Fans speculate on a possible Mad Max collaboration based on leaks and Mark's hint, relating "Nitro" to the speed boost mechanic.
  • Past hints from Mark have led fans to believe that "Nitro" could simply refer to a new in-game mechanic rather than a full collaboration.

Epic Games co-founder Mark Rein has revealed an interesting hint for the next Fortnite season, dropping the word "Nitro" when a fan asked him to describe it. This is not the first time that Mark has teased fans, as he is well-known for giving mysterious clues in the past as well right before the start of a new Fortnite season.

Fortnite events are always no less than a spectacle for fans, and the live event leading up to Chapter 5 Season 3 didn't disappoint as well. From showcasing the real power of Zeus to the strange disappearance of Pandora's Box in the Styx River, the event managed to build the right amount of hype for the upcoming season. As fans await more details about the release of Chapter 5 Season 3, Epic Games has dropped yet another interesting piece of information about the update.

Related
Rumor: Fortnite Could Be Crossing Over With Friday the 13th

A new rumor suggests Fortnite players may soon see a collaboration between Epic Games and the legendary Friday the 13th series.

In a new tweet, Vice President and Co-Founder of Epic Games Mark Rein further added to the ambiguity around the theme of the next season by giving fans an interesting clue. When asked by a fan to give a word to the upcoming season, Mark replied with the word "Nitro." Considering what leaks have suggested so far, this is not really a surprising word to see, as rumors about a post-apocalyptic themed Fortnite season have been making rounds for quite a while now.

Mark Rein's Customary Hint Fuels Mad Max Collab Rumors

In fact more than just the theme, the previously leaked Fortnite roadmap had suggested that a Mad Max collaboration could be on the cards. As highlighted by a couple of fans, nitro is a pretty common term in the Mad Max franchise, used multiple times for the speed boost mechanic cars get. Precisely, nitro is a short term for nitrous oxide, which is used in an internal combustion engine to provide more oxygen to the engine. This causes the horsepower of cars to increase, giving it a speed boost.

Fans are already debating what this hint could entail, with a few even suggesting that tying it in with the Mad Max collaboration could be a stretch, as it could simply be referring to an item for cars. The fact that Mark had revealed the word "Wings" for the last season, which ended up being a reference to Fortnite's Wings of Icarus , further consolidates this theory that it could be a mere mechanic which Mark is alluding to. With just a week to go before the launch of the next season, all the mysteries will be unraveling pretty soon.

item.title: EA Sports College Football 25 Reveals Cover Athletes, Release Date, and More
item.description:
Highlights

  • EA Sports College Football 25 reveals official cover athletes Donovan Edwards, Quinn Ewers, and Travis Hunter, launching July 19 on PS5/Xbox.
  • The cover art features college players' backs, a departure from Madden NFL series' style, with immersive atmospheres and 120fps gameplay.
  • Game exclusively for next-gen consoles, PC, Xbox One, and PS4 owners out of luck, with leaked details about Madden NFL 25 release date.

Details surrounding EA Sports College Football 25 are finally being revealed, with the highly-anticipated sports title officially revealing its multiple cover athletes, official release date, and other important information. The first college football video game to be released in over a decade since the now-pricey NCAA Football 14 , the new, re-named installment cover features Michigan running back Donovan Edwards, Texas quarterback Quinn Ewers, and Colorado wide receiver/defensive back Travis Hunter, launching July 19 on PS5 and Xbox Series X/S.

The official reveal of EA Sports College Football 25 's cover athletes will likely come as little surprise to those who have been closely following the football sim's development. According to multiple sources on Twitter/X, the PlayStation Store page of EA Sports College Football 25 accidentally revealed the game's artwork for its Deluxe Edition early, with EA only now officially revealing the cover art.

Related
College Football 25 Includes Important Feature

EA Sports College Football 25 will include a popular feature on Xbox consoles and possibly PlayStation 5 as well.

The first active college athletes to be featured on an EA Sports cover according to the company, the cover art interestingly takes somewhat of an opposite approach to its professional league counterpart, the Madden NFL series. Instead of a singular player facing at least mostly towards the camera, EA Sports College Football 25 purely features players' backs. Edwards is front-and-center, flanked by Ewers on the left and Hunter on the right. A few other players are included, although more towards the background, including Alabama's Jalen Milroe, Georgia's Carson Beck, and Ohio State's Quinshon Judkins.

A Collage of Colleges

A variety of other college team helmets can be seen even further away, like those of Notre Dame, Florida, Oregon and more. The newly released info about the title confirms the potential bad news for EA Sports College Football 25 fans , in that the game is exclusively releasing for next-gen consoles, meaning PC, Xbox One, and PS4 owners will be out of luck. The game is touted to feature 134 FBS schools with immersive atmospheres, and will feature 120fps gameplay, something likely beyond the prior console generation's capabilities.

EA Sports College Football 25 wasn't the only title to have its info leaked early, as Madden NFL 25 's release date and editions leaked ahead of its official reveal as well. The game will reportedly launch on August 16, roughly just a month after the launch of EA Sports College Football 25 . Should it be true, this summer is shaping up to be a great one for football video game fans everywhere.

item.title: Minecraft Gets New Map to Celebrate Franchise's 15th Anniversary
item.description:
Highlights

  • Minecraft celebrates its 15th anniversary with a new free map created by 100+ map makers from the community.
  • The game continues to evolve with the addition of items like the mace and the Trial Chambers in the upcoming update 1.21.
  • Players can claim free Character Creator items representing different years in the game's history until May 29 in Minecraft Bedrock Edition.

Minecraft has released a new free map to celebrate the franchise's 15th anniversary. Mojang introduced Minecraft to players in 2011, revealing a charismatic sandbox world made of blocks. Over time, Minecraft has grown to become one of the biggest hits in the video game industry.

In Minecraft , players survive as long as possible until they become strong enough to defeat the Ender Dragon . But despite having a final boss, Minecraft is a tool for players to create adventures that go far beyond defeating the powerful mob. In 15 years, Minecraft players have created mods that have added countless features, or data packs that have completely transformed Minecraft 's appearance. Minecraft is a huge success loved by millions of players, and to mark this year's anniversary, Mojang is giving the community a new gift.

Related
Minecraft Player Finds Item That Shouldn't Exist

A Minecraft player finds a valuable item during their adventures, but they are surprised to realize that their find has a rather unusual detail.

Minecraft has launched a new free map celebrating 15 years of the franchise. Subscribers to Java Realms, Minecraft 's private server subscription , can download the new free map to play in Minecraft Java Edition . The map was made by more than 100 map creators from the Minecraft community and also celebrates 10 years of Java Realms. Among the many locations that Minecraft players will find on the map are the Nether Ninjas Resort, the colorful Plagiatus' Lighthouse, the island city of Novo Ard, The Party Garden, and the Mundi Bunker.

Mojang Reveals Activities To Celebrate Minecraft's 15th Anniversary

A series of activities mark the anniversary of Mojang's big hit, including the distribution of free items to Minecraft players . Until May 29, every day Minecraft will give away a new Character Creator item representing a different year in the game's history. The first day's item was the Game Mode hoodie, and the second day's item was the Crafting Cap, which reproduces the surface of a crafting table. To claim the freebies, players need to access the Dressing Room in Minecraft Bedrock Edition .

While Minecraft players celebrate this year's anniversary, they are preparing for the next steps in the franchise. Minecraft will get the long-awaited update 1.21 , Tricky Trials, which will officially add many features tested in previous snapshots and previews. One of them is the mace, Minecraft 's new weapon capable of causing great damage to even the strongest enemies. Another eagerly awaited addition is the Trial Chambers, a new structure that will be the only possible place to find the Mace and Wind Charges, an item that will be in update 1.21 and can knock back enemies, and have other creative uses.
